title: Understanding the INSERT Statement
text: The INSERT statement is used to add new rows to a table in a database. It specifies the table name, the columns to insert data into, and the values to be inserted.

title: Column Specification in INSERT
text: When using the INSERT statement, you can specify the columns you want to insert data into. If you don't specify all columns, the remaining columns must have default values or allow NULLs.

title: Data Type Compatibility
text: Ensure that the data types of the values being inserted match the data types of the columns in the table. For example, inserting a string into a numeric column will cause an error.

hintAnswer: It will add a new row to the table.
title: Analyzing the Query
text: Given the query: INSERT INTO Parts (Price, Description) VALUES $$(35.00$$, 'Battery'); What will be the result of executing this query?
choices: It will add a new row to the table.
It will update an existing row in the table.
It will fail if the table has additional columns besides Price and Description.
It will fail if the Description column is defined as a numeric field.
